institution.name: Gordon Institute of Business Science
institution.mission: To significantly improve responsible individual and organisational performance, in South Africa and our broader African environment, primarily through high-quality business and management education.
institution.ambition: To build better societies, better leaders, and better business.
institution.campus_facilities: Modern classrooms, research centers, on-site accommodation at Illovo Hotel, proximity to Rosebank Gautrain station
institution.focus_areas: Africa-centric, ethical business practices, sustainability, SDGs, research in African management, ethics, innovation

accreditations: South African Council on Higher Education (CHE)
South African Business Schools Association (SABSA) member
Central and East European Management Development Association (CEEMAN) affiliate
UN Principles for Responsible Management Education (PRME) Champion

notable_members: Gill Marcus (former Governor of the South African Reserve Bank)
Professor Adrian Saville (Professor in Economics, Finance & Strategy, Founding Director of Centre for African Management and Markets)
Professor Anastacia Mamabolo (Full-Professor in research methods and entrepreneurship, Absa Chair in Entrepreneurship)

Gordon_Institute_of_Business_Science.history: Established in January 2000 with a donation from Sir Donald Gordon and University of Pretoria investment. Succeeded the Graduate School of Management (GSM), founded in 1949, which launched the first MBA outside North America. GSM formally replaced by GIBS in January 2008. Sir Donald Gordon (1930–2019) founded Liberty Life in 1957.
